Congratulations to Mallory A. and Tyson C., the recipients of the Lewis. F. Mayer Award and the Archie Griffin Award, respectively. They were surprised by their teachers with these high honors yesterday!

Also given annually, the Archie Griffin Award is named for Mr. Griffin, an Ohio native and the only two-time recipient of the Heisman Trophy for football. As a professional athlete, Griffin always displayed exemplary sportsmanship. This award is given to the student who shows Mr. Griffin‚Äôs core values in both academics and athletics: integrity, ethics, and sportsmanship.

Congratulations to two well-deserving students and their families!

Today our Gilles-Sweet staff received the Bronze Award at the State PBIS Recognition Showcase in Dayton for their efforts in implementing the successful #WarriorPride PBIS program at the elementary level.

Representing Gilles-Sweet was Associate Principal Matt Krivak, Principal Barb Brady, School Counselor Meredith Schulte, and Fourth Grade Teacher Nicole Pruente.

Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports (PBIS) is a proactive framework of evidence-based strategies and systems that assist schools in creating environments that are predictable, consistent, positive and safe. Benefits include improving academic performance and safety, decreasing challenging behaviors, and establishing a positive school climate for students and staff.
